remarks:
No variable is (effectively) free in a theorem. This and later "hypothesis-building" lemmas, with labels starting "hb...", allow us to construct proofs of formulas of the form ` |- ( ph -> A. x ph ) ` from smaller formulas of this form.  These are useful for constructing hypotheses that state " ` x ` is (effectively) not free in ` ph ` ."  (Contributed by NM, 11-May-1993.) 

---

 No variable is (effectively) free in a theorem. This and later "hypothesis-building" lemmas, with labels starting "hb...", allow us to construct proofs of formulas of the form ` |- ( ph -> A. x ph ) ` from smaller formulas of this form.  These are useful for constructing hypotheses that state " ` x ` is (effectively) not free in ` ph ` ."  (Contributed by NM, 5-Aug-1993.)
statement:
hbth.1 $e |- ph $.
hbth $p |- ( ph -> A. x ph ) $.
